title: Theory and Praxis
text:
The examples on this page describe professional practices of research within the field of library and information science.

Leadership in Libraries: Theories and Competencies

The most cited literature on library leadership would have one believe that it is an area unexplored and that its definition is elusive. However, there is one constant to focus on, and it is vision.

Read full research paper

My Hypothetical Queens Public Library
For the duration of my semester in Collection Development and Maintenance, I refered to the Queens Public Library (NY) for my assignments that utilized (real and fabricated) qualitative and quantitative data to assess community needs, build a more balanced collection, and develop a collection policy.

Community Needs Assessment
Building a Balanced Collection
Collection Development Policy

title: Knowledge Representation
text:
The examples provided on this page theorize and apply skills needed to represent information objects of various formats and utilize different technologies for knowledge representation.

The Danielle Janney Collection is one part of a greater group project focused on cataloging natural history objects from Florida. The project is hosted on Omeka and uses Dublin Core to describe the metadata of the selected resources.

click image to view the collection

From my essay, Understanding Metadata:

Metadata in a highly digitized world is transforming the world’s access to information. Search engines at personal and institutional levels relay thousands of query results in less than a second. Interoperability of metadata schema within collections face the challenge of effective crosswalks while preparing for the next phase of Linked Data and entity relationship models. Metadata is not a new concept, but how it is interacted with is breaking ground to unite the information landscape.


I learned the R programming language (LIS 5937), becoming familiar with RStudio and GitHub. I utilized a sample of food delivery data to ultimately create an R package and Markdown to compare days of the week, order totals, and tips received (sampled below).

I also kept a blog of assignments throughout the semester to track process and progress. (I’m sorry to say Tumblr now requires a log-in after so much scrolling, it wasn’t always this way.)
This portfolio website was created in RStudio and is hosted on GitHub! XD

title: Hi, I’m Danielle
text:
My career as an MLIS student began while working in the food service industry in the fall of 2020. By February of 2022, I found work in a public library as a part-time library assistant and a full-time position followed nine months later. My experience in restaurants has prepared me well for the library setting: I am capable of listening, fulfilling needs, understanding difficulties with following directions, troubleshooting technology, and I do not hesitate to ask for support.


Pursuing my degree and working in a library has granted me the experience to exchange knowledge between both environments. I am better able to appreciate the practical investments, technological challenges, human errors, and overall goodness a library does for its community.

title: Leadership and Innovation
text:
The examples on this page display my abilities to individually problem-solve and collaboratively communicate, engage in professional and community activities, and demonstrate leadership skills.

Project Proposal: QR Codes in Clearwater Countryside Library

The Clearwater Public Library System primarily depends on print materials to share information regarding library events, services, and policies, and overlooks the option of paperless dissemination of information. It is proposed the Clearwater Countryside branch pilots the display of quick-response (QR) code sheets featuring the most popular handouts to increase information accessibility, general outreach, and technological practices. The following document outlines a method of creating QR code sheets in Canva, includes a budget and timeline, and discusses additional uses for QR codes in the library.

Read full proposal

Summer Cinema and Public Library Movie Licensing
The Clearwater Countryside library patrons wanted to bring back movies on Sundays after the COVID-19 hiatus and my branch manager suggested a library assistant could sit in on them (since the librarians tended to be shorter staffed), so I volunteered to research and put together a seasonal trial program.

I was instructed to choose from movies available on Swank’s Public Libraries Movie Licensing website and I also put together a flyer on Canva to share on social media (see above image).
After solidifying the films and dates for my program at work, I was assigned (in Collection Development & Maintenance) with creating a handout for a library staff’s copyright professional development, so I focused on film.
View Copyright Professional Development handout

Webinars
I have completed over 20 webinars presented by Florida Library Webinars since the beginning of my library career in February 2022. View my certificates here:

title: Systems and Services
text:
The examples on this page identify diverse information resource needs of users.

I created a LibGuide for the Ringling Brothers and Barnum & Bailey Circus that exhibits resources freely available on the internet from museums, archives, YouTube, and Google Books.

click image to view LibGuide

My Reference Quest shows my processes of research for six questions that address various user needs. General internet research complemented USF’s academic databases to answer the specific queries.

My Aesthetics Program Web Archive Proposal identifies relevant resources for an academic program that also includes hands-on learning for students and defends the rights of use of content.

text:
